item.title: European Union approves first set of retaliatory tariffs on U.S. imports
item.description: The European Union on Wednesday voted to approve its first set of retaliatory measures to counter tariffs imposed by the U.S. on steel and aluminum.

item.title: Trade war latest: Trump yells 'BE COOL!' as China warns tourists, students of U.S. travel risks
item.description: President Donald Trump's tariffs are drawing swift retaliation from China, Canada and the European Union, deepening the global trade crisis.

item.title: German centrist parties reach coalition deal as Trump tariffs loom over Europe
item.description: The agreement paves the way for Germany's CDU, CSU and SPD to form the country's new government with Friedrich Merz as chancellor.

item.title: Trump's new 'reciprocal' tariffs take effect on imports from around the world
item.description: Trump brushed off concerns about stock market declines after his tariffs were announced. "America is going to be very rich again very soon," he said.

item.title: Trump's reciprocal tariffs plan kicks in; China vows again to impose countermeasures
item.description: President Donald Trump's country specific tariffs are in force, with trading partners continuing to respond.
